intro: Psychotria heteromera, commonly known as the "devil's breath" or "soul's bane," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species, many of which are known for their medicinal and ornamental uses. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in the undergrowth of tropical rainforests. The plant's botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
